p: Microorganisms, particularly endophytic bacteria isolated from different plants, have the ability to phosphate solubilize [ 65]. Dias et al. [ 66] showed that Bacillus subtilis and Bacillus megaterium, two endophytic bacteria obtained from strawberries, exhibit high phosphate solubilization and then enhance plant growth. Potassium (K) is another important element for metabolic responses because it acts as an activator for different enzymes [ 67]. N-fixing endophytic bacterial species are considered an eco-friendly approach to increase the N content and, hence, improve plant growth. In this study, Zea mays L. plants inoculated with two endophytic bacteria either individually or in consortium enhanced their P content compared with the control plants.
